instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - keep going into safemode.
threads.message:
not liquid damage.

trackpad was not letting me to use alt key during boot option. so i replaced the trackpad. now working.

but it keep going into safemode

i've tried new magsafe, without keyboard.

any idea?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - keep going into safemode.
threads.message:
PRAM reset has fixed.

case closed.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - keep going into safemode.
threads.message: This usually happens if someone fucks with the BIOS, so give that a quick check.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - keep going into safemode.
threads.message:
how can i tell in osx if some1 has fuck with the bios? 

i did check the bios chip, its has many dust and couldnt tell any rework since so old.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - keep going into safemode.
threads.message: Then it is probably fine, check serial number with bottom case too. Case closed.
